cinvestav.android.pki.cryptography.utils
Interface IDigestCryptoUtils

All Known Implementing Classes:
DigestCryptoUtils
public interface IDigestCryptoUtils

Interface for Digest functions, contains common functions for create digest using different algorithms

Since:
09/08/2012
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ing. Javier Silva PÃ©rez - [javier]

Method Detail

getDigest

byte[] getDigest(byte[] input,
                 java.lang.String algorithm)
                 throws CryptoUtilsException
Get the digest of the input using a desired algorithm,

Parameters:
input - Input to the digest function
algorithm - Algorithm that will be used as digest, see available algorithms at CryptoUtils ej. CryptoUtils.DIGEST_FUNCTION_SHA_1
Returns:
a byte array representing the digest of the input
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - If the name does not correspond to a supported digest algorithm

getDigest

byte[] getDigest(byte[] input)
                 throws CryptoUtilsException
Get the digest of the input using SHA-1 as digest algorithm,

Parameters:
input - Input to the digest function
Returns:
a byte array representing the digest of the input
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - If the name does not correspond to a supported digest algorithm

getDigest

java.lang.String getDigest(java.lang.String input,
                           java.lang.String algorithm,
                           java.lang.String encoder)
                           throws CryptoUtilsException
Get the digest of the input string using a desired algorithm

Parameters:
input - Input to the digest function
algorithm - Algorithm that will be used as digest, see available algorithms at CryptoUtils ej. CryptoUtils.DIGEST_FUNCTION_SHA_1
encoder - Base64 or HEX encoder to be used
Returns:
a string encoded using the selected encoder representing the digest of the input
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - If the name does not correspond to a supported digest algorithm

getDigest

java.lang.String getDigest(java.lang.String input,
                           java.lang.String algorithm)
                           throws CryptoUtilsException
Get the digest of the input string using a desired algorithm,

Parameters:
input - Input to the digest function
algorithm - Algorithm that will be used as digest, see available algorithms at CryptoUtils ej. CryptoUtils.DIGEST_FUNCTION_SHA_1
Returns:
a string encoded using Base64 that represents the digest of the input
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - If the name does not correspond to a supported digest algorithm
